about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.text: After a collision, if no one has been injured or killed and you can safely do so, you should move your vehicle out of the traffic lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.

comment.text: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.

suggestedAnswer.text: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.

comment.text: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Not move your vehicle for any reason.

comment.text: Not move your vehicle for any reason.

acceptedAnswer.text: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.

comment.text: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.

answerExplanation.text: After a collision, if no one has been injured or killed and you can safely do so, you should move your vehicle out of the traffic lane.

hasPart.name: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

about.name: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should: | You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.

comment.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.

comment.text: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

comment.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

comment.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

answerExplanation.text: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. hasPart.name: The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted.

about.name: The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted.

hasPart.assesses: The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted. | The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted. -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving within 500 to 1,000 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street, the speed limit is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph.

comment.text: 15 mph
25 mph
20 mph
25 mph

answerExplanation.text: When driving within 500 to 1,000 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street, the speed limit is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph.

hasPart.name: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers?

about.name: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers? | Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: They know other drivers will do the right thing.

comment.text: They know other drivers will do the right thing.

suggestedAnswer.text: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.

comment.text: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.

suggestedAnswer.text: They expect no breaks and give none.

comment.text: They expect no breaks and give none.

acceptedAnswer.text: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.

comment.text: They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.

answerExplanation.text: Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

comment.text: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers? | Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

about.name: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

hasPart.assesses: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: | Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

comment.text: Only at controlled intersections.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.

comment.text: Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.

suggestedAnswer.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

comment.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

acceptedAnswer.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

comment.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

answerExplanation.text: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

comment.text: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: | Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

hasPart.name: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should:

about.name: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should: | If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must stop at a railroad crossing where signs, warning devices, or flaggers warn you of the presence of a train. It is illegal to drive around lowered gates.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive around the crossing gates if you can't see a train.

comment.text: Drive around the crossing gates if you can't see a train.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and drive around the gates.

comment.text: Slow down and drive around the gates.

acceptedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.

answerExplanation.text: You must stop at a railroad crossing where signs, warning devices, or flaggers warn you of the presence of a train. It is illegal to drive around lowered gates.

comment.text: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should: | You must stop at a railroad crossing where signs, warning devices, or flaggers warn you of the presence of a train. It is illegal to drive around lowered gates.
